channel.title: Changing, adding a port
channel.description: I know I remember seeing a tutorial somewhere on how to add 1 or more listening ports to your server. How do u do it?

item.title: Changing, adding a port
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

[quote=“tonypker13, post:5, topic:231158”]Oh adding another…
Hmm im afraid Idk how to do that. Never even heard of that.
Maybe try this?
Add this line under the line you have

public static int serverlistenerPort = 5555; // 43594=default

What do you mean? Make it so you server is listening for on 2 ports? Could you possible add another public static int serverlistenerPorts underneath that and change the 43594? Just one crazy idea.
[/quote]
LOLOL I posted that like 2 seconds after you replied XD thats crazy…[/quote]
:D. Lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing, adding a port
item.dc:creator: @archerkill30 archerkill30
item.description:
@archerkill30 wrote:

Heres my code right now

public static int serverlistenerPorts = 43594;

How do u add another listening port to that? I know its possible i just cant remember atm

Read full topic

item.title: Changing, adding a port
item.dc:creator: @tonypker13 tonypker13
item.description:
@tonypker13 wrote:

Into server.java

Search for serverlistenerPort
Youll see 2 numbers near the end that contain your port.

Change those to whatever you want then compile.

Read full topic
